intro: Oxydectes sampatik, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Oxydectes sampatik thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
